intro: Scariola alpestris, commonly known as the alpine scariola, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand harsh weather. Scariola alpestris produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in the summer months.
